Class Component

java.lang.Object
fr.tp.inf112.projects.robotsim.model.Component
All Implemented Interfaces:
Figure, Visitable, Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ChargingStation, Conveyor, Door, Factory, ProductionMachine, Robot, Room
public abstract class Component extends Object implements Figure, Serializable, Visitable
This file contains the definition of the abstract Component class, which represents a component in the robot simulation. The class provides methods to manage the component's position, dimensions, style, and interactions with other components.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • Component

      public Component(String name, int x, int y, int width, int height, Style style, Shape shape, Factory factory, boolean obstacle)
      Constructor to initialize a component, add itself to the non-null factory provided. Sets visitPosition to the center of the component by default.
      Parameters:
      name - Name of the component.
      x - X-coordinate of the top-left corner.
      y - Y-coordinate of the top-left corner.
      width - Width of the component.
      height - Height of the component.
      style - Style of the component.
      shape - Shape of the component.
      factory - Factory to which the component belongs.
      obstacle - Specify if the component should be considered an obstacle.

    • overlays

      public boolean overlays(int x, int y, int size)
      Checks if this component overlaps with a square centered at (x, y).
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the square's center
      y - the y-coordinate of the square's center
      size - the size of the square (width and height)
      Returns:
      true if the square overlaps this component, false otherwise

    • overlays

      public boolean overlays(int x, int y, int width, int height)
      Checks if this component overlaps with a rectangle centered at (x, y).
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the rectangle's center
      y - the y-coordinate of the rectangle's center
      width - the width of the rectangle
      height - the height of the rectangle
      Returns:
      true if the rectangle overlaps this component, false otherwise

    • overlays

      public boolean overlays(Component other)
      Checks if this component overlaps with another component.
      Parameters:
      other - The other component.
      Returns:
      True if the components intersect, false otherwise.

      y - Y-coordinate of the point.
      Returns:
      True if the point is inside, false otherwise.

    • setVisitPosition

      public void setVisitPosition(int x, int y)
      Sets the visit position to the specified x, y.
      Parameters:
      x - the x-coordinate of the position to assign as the visit target
      y - the y-coordinate of the position to assign as the visit target

    • setVisitPosition

      public void setVisitPosition(String label, int size)
      Sets visitPosition based on a directional label around a rectangular component. The position is offset from the component by a margin of size / 2 + 1.

      Valid labels (case-insensitive):

      • "top", "bottom", "left", "right", "center"
      • "d-top-left", "d-top-right", "d-bottom-left", "d-bottom-right"
      Parameters:
      label - the direction relative to the component
      size - the robot or spacing size used to calculate margin
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the label is invalid

    • setVisitPosition

      public void setVisitPosition(String label)
      Sets the visit position based on a directional label using the default robot size.
      Parameters:
      label - the direction label (e.g., "top", "center", "d-bottom-right")
      See Also:
      • for more details.

    • behave

      public void behave()
      Defines the behavior of the component. Can be overridden by subclasses.
